narrative.fact: Polish founder Simon Grabowski built his first autoresponder in 1997 and started GetResponse to provide simple email tools from a small city in Poland.
The mission from the start was to tailor easy, affordable marketing tools for businesses that lacked straightforward email automation options.
Grabowski registered the getresponse.com domain in 1998 to productize his autoresponder and launch the service publicly.
The early product centered on autoresponders and simple newsletter sends, forming the base for todayâ€™s automation, landing pages, and webinars.
GetResponse reached 300,000 customers by 2013 and, per a 2025 independent review, now serves more than 350,000 customers in 183 countries.
Unlike email-only tools, GetResponse bundles automation, landing pages/websites, and built-in webinars within one platform.
The lineup now spans a free plan (2,500 sends) and paid tiers from $19/month Starter to $69/month Creator, plus enterprise Max with custom pricing around $1,099/month.

story_judgement.reason: Founder-led origin, measurable adoption (350k+ customers across 183 countries), and a growing email marketing market support article viability.
